definition: dog's leg/fig. one who follows a villain/henchman/hired thug

sentences.english: Downslope dogleg right, bunkers are waiting at the landing area.
sentences.chinese: 落斜右狗腿，落點有沙池在等着你。

sentences.english: The green is behind the grove.
sentences.chinese: 這是右狗腿洞，果嶺在那片樹林後面。

sentences.english: Dogleg left. water on the left. Green is narrow and long.
sentences.chinese: 左狗腿，左邊有水，果嶺長而窄。

sentences.english: The dog-leg severity of this well is not very big.
sentences.chinese: 這口井的狗腿度變化率不大。

sentences.english: the mainstream civil-rights leaders whom Malcolm denounced as “stooges” and “lackeys.
sentences.chinese: 而馬爾科姆則斥責他們爲“走狗”和“狗腿子”。

sentences.english: This is the dogleg right. The green is behind the grove.
sentences.chinese: 這是右狗腿洞，果嶺在那片樹林後面。

sentences.english: I am convinced the other captives are flunkies and maybe snitches.
sentences.chinese: 我確信其它俘虜都是狗腿子或告密者。

sentences.english: Upslope long Par 4, dogleg right, elevated green.
sentences.chinese: 長右狗腿上斜四杆洞，果嶺升起左。

sentences.english: Dogleg left, tight entrance, indeed, the fairway is much wider than you see.
sentences.chinese: 左狗腿，入口睇落好窄，不過其實落點好闊。

sentences.english: Dogleg right. The sea of bunkers stretches 30 yards infront of the green.
sentences.chinese: 右狗腿，果嶺前30碼繫個沙海，非常壯觀。

sentences.english: The 1st hole is a medium length dogleg left par 4.
sentences.chinese: 第一洞是個中距離左狗腿四杆洞。

sentences.english: Downslope dogleg right, green is elevated and guarded by bunkers on both side.
sentences.chinese: 落斜右狗腿，果嶺升起，兩邊有沙池。

sentences.english: This " henchman " came from a poor family in the countryside with a lot of younger brothers and sisters.
sentences.chinese: “狗腿子”家在農村，兄弟姐妹一大堆，純屬困難戶。

sentences.english: Dogleg left, water on left. Teeshot too much right will leave longer approach distance.
sentences.chinese: 左狗腿，左邊有水，開波太右會令攻果嶺更遠。

definition: dog's leg/fig. one who follows a villain/henchman/hired thug
to curry favor by showing obeisance (idiom)
lit. a vile character flourishes (idiom)/fig. an inferior person gets into a position of power, becoming conceited and arrogant
to grimace (in pain)/to show one's teeth/to bare one's fangs
to ingratiate oneself with/to pander to
to nod one's head and bow (idiom); bowing and scraping/unctuous fawning
